intro: Sphenostemon arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfak mountain gum, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of West Papua. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with a hairy surface. It produces small, white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
